value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: DAX Fridays! #78: When should I use FILTER() with CALCULATE?
value.excerpt: When should you use the filter function with CALCULATE?  As you probably have noticed, sometimes people use a column in the filter part of CALCULATE and sometimes they use the FILTER function.  The question is, when should you use what?  In this video I will try to clarify that question.  Dont miss part

value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,

value.title: Blank row in DAX
value.excerpt: VALUES and DISTINCT are two functions that differ in how they could add a blank row to the result (or not). value.title: Power BI Shows Incorrect Measure Total? How to fix it?
value.excerpt: During this session, we will try to resolve one of the most common issues that occur in Power BI Desktop which is Incorrect Measure Total issue for table or matrix visual. Sometimes, we have multiple tables in our report and we have prepared some DAX expression to calculate some values in our report.

value.title: Get a field value from a related table in Power BI DAX RELATED Function Explained
value.excerpt: Sometimes, in Power BI, you need to access a field’s value from another table that somehow is related to the existing table. value.title: Power BI DAX   Previous Month to Date, Quarter to Date, and Year to Date Calculations
value.excerpt: If you want to compare the sales up to a particular day and compare it with the previous period (month, quarter, or year) but up to that particular day in that period, then it is called previous month-to-date, previous quarter-to-date, and previous year-to-date. value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #1: How to write DAX measures....fast in Power BI

value.title: Showing Ranking in a Visual in Power BI using RANKX DAX function
value.excerpt: If you want to show the ranking in a Power BI visual, one way is to use a visual that supports that, such as a Ribbon chart. Another way, which is a more common way, is to write a calculation for rank, and RANKX is a DAX function that can help you with that. In this article and video, I explain how that
